args:
The party hears of the battle the primal dragons
faced long ago, and how Bahamut was a fusion
of the five primal Greatwyrms created to fight
the Progenitor. But when the party attempts to
regain that power, Beren attacks.
So tell us, Primordial Windwyrm.\nTell us how you faced the Progenitor.
Do you know of the battle between\nthe two creators?
A bit. We know that at the end of the battle\nwith the Origin, the Progenitor was sealed\naway in a space beyond all worlds.
We also know the Origin lost his physical\nform and his ability to directly interact\nwith the world. And...yeah. That's about it.
From that point on, the world was run\nby us—his creations.
But some time after that, things changed.
The Progenitor found his way back from the\nspace beyond all worlds, returning to our\nreality once more.
The Progenitor rejected all possibility.\nHe asserted that the only correct world\nwas a singular perfect one.
Thus, he forged a world of his own ideals\nand attempted to destroy all other possible\nexistences.
We tried to stand against him, but all our\nefforts were meaningless in the face of his\nability to lock causality.
Yeah, we've learned that the brute-force\napproach doesn't do jack against this guy.\nSo how'd you end up fighting him?
The only one who could hope to stand\nagainst the Progenitor was the Origin.
Makes sense, but we can't exactly do that.\nThat's why we're in this mess.
The Origin lost his physical form,\nalong with his powers, correct?
Yes, the Origin did indeed lose his body—\nbut that was a mere vessel. So we decided\nto prepare a new one.
Far easier said than done. It'd be a\nmassive undertaking to find a vessel\ncapable of taking the Origin's powers.
Indeed, we knew we could not choose just\nany vessel—which is why we offered up\nour own bodies as sacrifice.
We five offered our bodies to create\na singular combined vessel.
So the Origin returned because the Five\nGreatwyrms combined into one body?
Alas, even our combined might was still\nnot sufficient to contain the Origin.
So all your sacrifices were for nothing?!
No. We could not afford to let it go\nto waste.

As we had little time left to fight the
Progenitor, we forged an incomplete form
that was capable of containing the Origin's
will for destruction alone.
That is what we imbued his vessel with.
You created a dragon composed of the\nFive Greatwyrms and filled it with a\ndestructive will? By the Goddess...
This dragon was forced to manifest as an\nincomplete materialization, but manifest\nit did. And we named ourselves...
So Bahamut was not, in fact, the Origin?
Bahamut is a part of the Origin,\nbut not the being entire.
But after we became one with the will of\ndestruction within Bahamut, there arose a\nnew desire within us.
This was the will of Bahamut—a thing\nwholly separate from the will of the Origin.
That presence I felt alongside Bahamut's\nwill earlier must have been the Origin.
But the Bahamut with whom we forged a\npact had also lost his body and was in\nsearch of a new vessel. Why was that?

Though we could fight against the
Progenitor as Bahamut, an imperfect
manifestation could not hope to stand
against the creator of the world.
But I thought this plan managed to seal\nthe Progenitor away again! Er, right?
Our death was not in vain, for we were\nable to destroy the Progenitor's world.
Furthermore, we still had the world\nthat the Origin created to seal the\nProgenitor away.
And Elysium held the Primal Mark as well.\nWith all those factors together, we were\nable to seal off the Progenitor once more.
After Bahamut's death, we returned to\nmana and became new wind, flame,\nwater, light, and shadow.
Thus did Bahamut desire a new vessel,\nand he began wandering the worlds in\nan attempt to secure one.
Which is how he eventually found me.
I think I'm following this so far, but there's\none more thing we have to know.
Indeed. As you well know, the Progenitor\nhas invaded our world anew.
And as terrible as this is to admit, we don't\nhave the power to stand up to him now—\nso we're here to get it back.
We need the power you possess.\nThe primal power.
If you know of a way to restore the\npower we lost each time we were\nreborn, please tell us.
What an odd thing to say.\nWe do not lose our powers.

We are the wind. When our body and
power return to mana, it simply becomes
the wind that crosses the world again.
Even if our body changes, we lose nothing.
Though you say that all wind is a part of\nmy power, I am currently unable to control\nbut a portion of it.
Hey! Don't you dare clam up now, bub!\nWe need to get our primal powers back\ntoot sweet!
We're gonna make it so that Xenos jerk\nwon't even see what's comin'!
Ah. So that is your goal.
So you've come to play Xenos's lapdog\nand try to take us out, eh?
What an egotistical thing to say.\nHe isn't paying you lot any mind.
The future is already set in stone,\nso there is no way you can fight against\nwhat he has ordained.
Well, in that case, why don't you make like\na bee and buzz off? I mean, it's not like\nwe can hurt you, right?
Because I cannot abide the lot of you.
You may indeed be harmless, but it would\nmake my world far less irritating if you\nwere no longer in it.
I believe the time for talk has past,\nif indeed it ever was here.
